title: 109_hr2875
content: The Act may be cited as the "Public Lands Corps Healthy Forests Restoration Act of 2005" and includes amendments to the Public Lands Corps Act of 1993. The Public Lands Corps Act of 1993 is amended to include a definition of "priority project" as a conservation project on eligible service lands to address wildfire risk, protect watersheds, and combat forest health threats. The Public Lands Corps Act of 1993 is amended to include a definition of "priority project" as a conservation project on eligible service lands to address wildfire risk, protect watersheds, combat forest health threats, and promote recovery of threatened or endangered species, improve biological diversity, and enhance productivity and carbon sequestration. The term "Secretary" is defined as the Secretary of Agriculture for National Forest System land and with respect to Indian lands and Hawaiian home. The Public Lands Corps Act of 1993 is amended to give preference to qualified youth or conservation corps for contracts and agreements in specific areas with a substantial youth membership. The Public Lands Corps Act of 1993 is amended to prioritize youth or conservation corps with economically, physically, or educationally disadvantaged members for projects in specific areas. The Public Lands Corps Act of 1993 is amended to authorize appropriate conservation projects on various lands as part of disaster prevention or relief efforts. Additionally, Section 205 is amended to support conservation centers and programs. Section 205 of the Public Lands Corps Act of 1993 is amended to support conservation centers and programs. The Public Lands Corps Act of 1993 is amended to allow the Secretary to establish conservation centers for use by the Public Lands Corps and for conservation projects. The Secretary can provide necessary services, facilities, and equipment to these centers and must establish basic standards for health and safety. The Secretary may enter into contracts with State or local agencies or private organizations for the management of conservation centers. The Secretary can also provide services, facilities, equipment, and oversight to carry out the Public Lands Corps Act. The Public Lands Corps Act of 1993 is amended to provide living allowances to participants and resource assistants. The Secretary may grant credit for time served and noncompetitive hiring status to former members. Additionally, funding for the Public Lands Corps Act is addressed. The Public Lands Corps Act of 1993 is amended to address funding by adding amounts allocated through other Federal programs or projects. SEC. 211. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Authorization of Appropriations: $15,000,000 is authorized annually for fiscal years 2007 through 2011 to carry out priority projects. Funds remain available for obligation and expenditure until the end of the following fiscal year. Amendments are made to the Public Lands Corps Act of 1993. Amendments are made to various sections of the Public Lands Corps Act of 1993, including changing references from "Secretaries" to "Secretary" in multiple subsections. Amendments to the Public Lands Corps Act of 1993 include changing references from "Secretaries" to "Secretary" in different subsections. Amendments to the Public Lands Corps Act of 1993 involve changing references from "Secretaries" to "Secretary" in various subsections. Amendments to the Public Lands Corps Act of 1993 involve changing references from "Secretaries" to "Secretary" in various subsections. The change includes replacing "the Interior and the Secretary of Agriculture" with just "Secretary".
